intro: Galium cuspidulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, with a distinctive pointed tip, contributing to its common name.
